intro: Rosa villosa var. scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf dog玫瑰, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It features compound leaves with serrated edges and a hairy texture, giving it its scientific name. The plant produces fragrant, pink to white flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained soil. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and showy blooms, making it a popular choice for gardens.
